javaHome.imagineTitle: Imagine you don't have to write tests.
javaHome.testsGenText:
But you still have a perfect bug detector for your code.
And no false positives among bugs.
Tests are generated automagically — with the highest code coverage,
fine-tuned mocking, and human-readable test descriptions.
Sounds fantastic? No more.
javaHome.testsGenAdvantagesText:
While a test template tool gives you just an outline,
UnitTestBot generates ready-to-use test cases —
with valid inputs, method bodies, assertions, and comments.
javaHome.checkGuideText: Install, generate, run: check the quick guide
javaHome.utbotAdvantagesText: UnitTestBot has a dynamic symbolic execution engine in its core, complemented with a smart fuzzing technique. Together they can explore program execution paths, covering as many of them as possible while keeping test suite minimized.
javaHome.findBugsNooneCanTitle: Find bugs no one can catch.
javaHome.findBugsNooneCanText: UnitTestBot can uncover bugs hidden deeply in an interprocedural control flow graph. All the found bugs are indeed real — zero false positive rate is guaranteed.
javaHome.howToUseResultText: Learn how to get use of UnitTestBot results
javaHome.mocksText: Want to mock I/O operations, random number generator or other modules? UnitTestBot provides you with both default and fine adjustment options for your mocks.
javaHome.mockingSettingsText: Get to know mocking settings in UnitTestBot
javaHome.humanReadableText: UnitTestBot represents all the test descriptions in a human-readable format. The intelligible test method names and comments help you to control the whole testing process. Test failed? The description refers you to points of interest in execution paths.
javaHome.getBetterTestDescriptionText: See how to get the most out of test descriptions
javaHome.capableForYourNeedText: Capable for every tech you need.
javaHome.capableForEveryText:
UnitTestBot for Java and Kotlin supports the latest JDKs, JUnit 4, JUnit 5, TestNG, Mockito and works with all popular operational systems.
You can also try UnitTestBot for C/C++. UnitTestBot for Python, Go, and JavaScript are under development. Stay tuned!

pythonHome.utbotPythonText:
UnitTestBot for Python code is in development.
Wait a while for the next release.

javaScriptHome.utbotPythonText:
UnitTestBot for JavaScript code is in development.
Wait a while for the next release.

goHome.utbotPythonText:
UnitTestBot for Go code is in development.
Wait a while for the next release.

docs.cdocsText: Documentation for UnitTestBot C/C++ can be accessed via link below.
docs.javadocsText: Documentation for UnitTestBot Java can be accessed via link below.

install.mainPart1:
UnitTestBot project provides users with 2 engines generating tests:
  • UnitTestBot C/C++ (requires Ubuntu 18.04 or higher)
  • UnitTestBot Java (tested on Win64, Linux 64)
install.mainPart2:
UTBot offers convenient ways to interact with its functionality. Users can install and use corresponding plugins:
  • Visual Studio Code plugin for C/C++ languages (see installation guide)
  • IntelliJ IDEA plugin for Java language (see installation guide)
install.alert: UnitTestBot C/C++ supports only small subset of C++ for now

utbot.alertCpp: <small>Only small subset of C++ is supported</small>

aboutUs.whoWeAreText:
We are a team of researchers from Saint Petersburg.

We are crazy about mathematics and programming. We love taking part in software testing competitions. We describe our achievements in research articles. To be in touch with the high-end science we collaborate with the universities:
aboutUs.whatWeDevelopText:
Though all these things may sound nerdy, we believe we develop a useful tool for real-life programmers. We try to make UnitTestBot effective and user-friendly — so that we are happy with it when we use it ourselves. And we welcome you to join us in developing UnitTestBot!

Contact us directly to ask a question, share your ideas or give us feedback — we will be glad to hear from you!
aboutUs.visitGitHubText: Visit our GitHub page and feel free to contribute!
